ab.title: Exodus 9
ab.l: And the Lord said to Moses, ‘Come to Pharaoh,and speak to him, saying, “Thus says the LordGod of the Hebrews, “Let my people go, somay they serve me.
Because if you are not willingto let go and you are still holding them strongly,
Lo,the wrath of the Lord will be on your livestock that are in the field, on the horses,on the donkeys, on the camels, on the cattle, and on the sheep: a very severe pestilence.
And the Lord will separate between the livestockof Israel and the livestock of Egypt. And nothing will die of allthat is of the children of Israel.””’
And the Lord has setan appointed time, saying, ‘At daybreak the Lord will do this thingin the land.’
And the Lord did thatthing after daybreak, and all the livestock of Egypt died,but of the livestock of Israel not one died.
AndPharaoh sent, and, lo, there was not one of the livestock of Israel dead.And the heart of Pharaoh was hardened, and he did not letthe people go.
And the Lord said to Mosesand to Aaron, ‘Take to you handfulsof lime kiln soot, and Moses shall sprinkle it toward the skiesin the sight of Pharaoh.
And it shall become fine dustover all the land of Egypt, and shall becomeboils spreading with abscesses on man and on livestock,all over the land of Egypt.’
So they tooksoot of the lime kiln, and stood beforePharaoh. And Moses sprinkled it up toward heaven, andit became boils spreading with abscesses on man, |and| on livestock.
And the magicians could not stand beforeMoses by reason of the boils, for the boils were on themagicians, and on all Egypt.
And the Lord hardenedthe heart of Pharaoh, and he did not listen to them — asthe Lord had spoken to Moses.
And the Lord said to Moses,‘Rise up early in the morning, stand before Pharaoh, andsay to him, “Thus said the Lord God of the Hebrews, “Letmy people go, so that they may serve me.
Becausethis time I will send all my punishments at your heart, and at your servants,and at your people, so that you may know that there is none like me in allthe earth.
Because by now I could have reached out my wrath,and smite you and your people with pestilence, and you would have beencut off from the earth.
And, of a truth, for this reasonI have raised you up: to show you my power, sothat my name may be declared in all the earth.
If you are stillexalting yourself against my people not to let them go:
Lo, at this time at daybreak I will cause very strong hail to fall,such as never has been in Egypt from the day it was foundeduntil now.

And now send, gatheryour livestock and all that you have in the field. All themen and livestock that shall be found in the field and is not gatheredhome: the hail will come down on them, and they will die.””’
The one who feared the word of the Lord among the servants of Pharaohmade his servants and his livestock flee to the houses.
And the one who did not pay attention to the word of the Lordleft his servants and his livestock in the field.
And the Lord said to Moses, ‘Reach out your handtoward the skies, so that there may be hail in all the land of Egypt,on man, and on livestock, and on every plantof the field in the land of Egypt.’
AndMoses reached out his staff toward the skies, and the Lord gave thunderand hail, and sparked fire ran on the ground, and the Lord rained hailon the land of Egypt.
And there was hail, and fire was sparkingin the midst of hail, very strong, such as there was nonelike it in all the land of Egypt since it became a kingdom.
And the hail smote in all the land of Egypt allthat was in the field, both man and animal, and the hail smoteall the plants of the field and broke every tree of the field.
Only in the land of Goshen, wherethe children of Israel were, was there no hail.
And Pharaoh sent,and called for Moses and Aaron, and said to them, ‘I sinnedthis time. The Lord is righteous, and I and my peopleare wicked.
Pray to the Lord, and may it be enough ofmighty thundering and hail, and let me let you go, andyou shall not continue to stay.’

And Moses said to him, ‘As I goout of the city, I will reach out my hands before the Lord. Thethunder will cease, and there will be no more hail, so that you mayknow that, indeed, the earth is in the Lord’s hand.
And youand your servants: I know that until this punishment leaves, you will fearbefore the Lord God.
And the flaxand the barley was smitten, because the barley was in the ear, andthe flax was in blades.
But the wheatand the rye were not smitten, because they were covered.’
And Moses went out of the city from before Pharaoh, and spreadhis hands to the Lord, and the thunders and thehail ceased, and the rain was not poured on the earth.
And Pharaoh sawthat the rain and the hail and the thunders were ceased,and he sinned yet again, and hardened his heart, he andhis servants.
And the heart of Pharaoh was hardened, and he did not letthe children of Israel go — as the Lord had spoken through theprophecy of Moses.
